duties_responsibilities.duty: Provide function-based treatments and interventions to patients during their hospitalization, guiding them through the continuum of care.
Collaborate with occupational therapists, physical therapists, case management team, social workers, nursing staff, and physicians to ensure evidence-based practice for patients.
Foster interdisciplinary team approach with dynamic communication to provide well-rounded treatment to patients.
Create efficient treatment plans based on current evidence-based guidelines to help patients return to their prior level of functioning.
Build trust and communication to achieve high patient satisfaction scores.
Offer clinical instruction to incoming students and provide peer mentorship for individual growth opportunities.
Participate in monthly Inpatient Evidence Hour hosted by Inpatient leaders.
Work with a diverse patient population and provide therapies for conditions such as Neuro, Trauma, Ortho, Wound Care, and Hand Therapy.
Live through PT Solutions core values to foster a positive work environment.
Ensure compliance with state licensure and Basic Life Support Certification requirements.
Maintain local and national organization dues and license renewal fees reimbursed by PT Solutions.

education_certification.credential: Graduate of a Speech-Language Pathology program, State Licensure, Certificate of Clinical Competence through the American Speech-Language-Hearing Association, Basic Life Support Certification from the American Heart Association
